New Records: Shakib Al Hasan became the first batter from Bangladesh to score more than 2,500 runs in men's T20Is, and also became only the sixth Asian batter to complete the milestone of 2,500 runs in T20I cricket.
Key Match Events: Tanzid Hasan took on the onus of scoring quickly in the powerplay, hitting 5 boundaries and a six for his 26-ball 35.
Shakib Al Hasan used all his experience and hit an unbeaten 64 after having stitched a 41-run partnership with Mahmadullah, who hit 21-ball 25.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh were hoping for a positive result in their crunch match as they suffered a heartbreaking 4-run defeat to South Africa, days after beating Sri Lanka in their opener.
Post-Match Reflections: Shakib Al Hasan expressed relief after breaking the 2500-run barrier in T20Is, ending a lean patch.
Shakib Al Hasan's 64 not out helped Bangladesh post 159 on the board in their quota of 20 overs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh got off to a poor start after Netherlands won the toss and opted to bowl, losing their captain Najmul Shanto for 1 while Litton Das followed for 1 as they were reeling at 23 for 2 in the 4th over.
Others: Shakib Al Hasan is featuring in his 9th T20 World Cup, having played every edition since the inaugural edition in 2007.
